Fall 2014 - Democratic Regression in Southeast Asia and its Implications         Each Tuesday, Conflict, Security, and Development Series will examine new research, discuss creative policy approaches and highlight recent innovations in responding to the challenges of security and development in conflict and post-conflict situations.  This series is co-presented by the Center for Human Rights and Global Justice at NYU Law School, the Center for Global Affairs at NYU’s School for Continuing and Professional Studies, NYU's Global Institute for Public Health, and the Office of International Programs at NYU Wagner.         Please select the session(s) for which you would like to RSVP.     Please RSVP for at least one event.           Tuesday, Sep. 9, 2014, 12:30pm-1:30pm Update on Rwanda: 20 Years After the Genocide Update on Rwanda: 20 Years After the Genocide Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Tuesday, Sep. 16, 2014, 12:30pm-1:30pm The Place of Human Rights in a Renewed Global Push to End Extreme Poverty The Place of Human Rights in a Renewed Global Push to End Extreme Poverty Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Tuesday, Sep. 23, 2014, 12:30pm-1:30pm Crisis on the Southern Border Crisis on the Southern Border Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Tuesday, Sep. 30, 2014, 12:30pm-1:30pm Brazil’s Transitional Justice Policies: Perspectives from a Federal Prosecutor Brazil’s Transitional Justice Policies: Perspectives from a Federal Prosecutor Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Tuesday, Oct. 7, 2014, 12:30pm-1:30pm Drug Policy Reform: How Did We Get Here and What is Next? Drug Policy Reform: How Did We Get Here and What is Next? Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Tuesday, Oct. 21, 2014, 12:30pm-1:30pm Democratic Regression in Southeast Asia and its Implications Democratic Regression in Southeast Asia and its Implications Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map         Please RSVP for at least one event. This series is co-presented by the Center for Human Rights and Global Justice at NYU Law School, the Center for Global Affairs at NYU’s School for Continuing and Professional Studies, NYU's Global Institute for Public Health, and the Office of International Programs at NYU Wagner. Spring 2014 - The Battle for the 'True Islam' in Indonesia         The Conflict, Security, and Development Series is co-presented by the Center for Human Rights and Global Justice at NYU Law School, the Center for Global Affairs at NYU’s School for Continuing and Professional Studies, NYU's Global Institute for Public Health, and the Office of International Programs at NYU Wagner.        Each Tuesday, the Conflict, Security, and Development series will examine new research, discuss creative policy approaches and highlight recent analytical and practical innovations in responding to the challenges of security and development in the context of conflict and post-conflict situations.This series is co-presented by the Center for Human Rights and Global Justice at NYU Law School, the Center for Global Affairs at NYU’s School for Continuing and Professional Studies, NYU's Global Institute for Public Health, and the Office of International Programs at NYU Wagner.        Please select the session(s) for which you would like to RSVP.     Please RSVP for at least one event.           Tuesday, Feb. 4, 2014, 12:30pm-1:30pm Stabilization and Development: Risk Frameworks and Programs in Somalia,r Stabilization and Development: Risk Frameworks and Programs in Somalia,r Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Tuesday, Feb. 11, 2014, 12:30pm-1:30pm Food Insecurity and Conflict in Afghanistan Food Insecurity and Conflict in Afghanistan Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Tuesday, Feb. 18, 2014, 12:30pm-1:30pm Securing Land Rights for Palestinian citizens of Israel Securing Land Rights for Palestinian citizens of Israel Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Tuesday, Feb. 25, 2014, 12:30pm-1:30pm Security and Development Challenges in Afghanistan: Which Comes First? Security and Development Challenges in Afghanistan: Which Comes First? Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Tuesday, Mar. 4, 2014, 1:30pm-2:30pm Islamic Studies and Early Childhood Education in Countries Affected by Conflict: The Role of Mosque Schools in Remote Afghan Villages Islamic Studies and Early Childhood Education in Countries Affected by Conflict: The Role of Mosque Schools in Remote Afghan Villages Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map               Tuesday, Mar. 11, 2014, 12:30pm-1:30pm The Battle for the 'True Islam' in Indonesia The Battle for the 'True Islam' in Indonesia Location: The Puck Building, The Rudin Family Forum for Civic Dialogue, 2nd Fl.  295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604 &nbsp map         Please RSVP for at least one event. Spring 2014 - The Battle for the 'True Islam' in Indonesia         The Conflict, Security, and Development Series is co-presented by the Center for Human Rights and Global Justice at NYU Law School, the Center for Global Affairs at NYU’s School for Continuing and Professional Studies, NYU's Global Institute for Public Health, and the Office of International Programs at NYU Wagner.        Each Tuesday, the Conflict, Security, and Development series will examine new research, discuss creative policy approaches and highlight recent analytical and practical innovations in responding to the challenges of security and development in the context of conflict and post-conflict situations.This series is co-presented by the Center for Human Rights and Global Justice at NYU Law School, the Center for Global Affairs at NYU’s School for Continuing and Professional Studies, NYU's Global Institute for Public Health, and the Office of International Programs at NYU Wagner.
